entry.title: Dark Knight, Gayass Loser
entry.summary:
Author: EmpressSheev558

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 372Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 10

Summary: Ninth of September: "3 years of night have turned me into a nocturnal animal, a silent predator hunting the dregs of Gotham. I am vengeance. I am the night. But he makes me feel like that's not all I am, all I could be. Alfred, Selena, all the love they've given me, and yet it's a reporter from Metropolis that breaks my walls down like no-one else has. I love Clark Kent."   Bruce Wayne is fully aware that he has become something barely recognisable as human. "Bruce Wayne" is just a mask, a disguise that allows him to enact vengeance on the criminals of the city of Gotham. Some days, he wakes up and barely recognises himself in the mirror. It's not all bad though. More often than not, he has the wonderful and kind-hearted Clark Kent to come home to, a reporter from Metropolis. Clark is one of the only things that makes Bruce feel human. But there are things Bruce doesn't know about Clark. The world's greatest detective has no idea that Clark Kent is one of the most powerful beings on the face of the Earth. And Batman really can't stand Superman.

entry.title: Stars Over Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: svperb4t

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,339Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Clark Kent can't explain why he dislikes Bruce Wayne—he just does. Bruce, on the other hand, is completely smitten with the awkward reporter from the Daily Planet. entry.title: There's Something So Lonesome About You
entry.summary:
Author: hoeforhoran28

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 62,068Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 1,063

Summary: "Your identity was supposed to be a secret. Not only to protect yourself (and probably least importantly yourself) but others. Your family, your friends. Everyone who stood a chance at being ripped apart by your decision to go out there everyday and put yourself in the crossfire.Not that Bruce had anyone to protect, besides Alfred. But it was still a fucking given."Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. An important reason that just doesn't seem to be as important to the rest of the League as it is to him. This is going to be a story about Bruce being coaxed into allowing others behind his carefully built walls. (Specifically one person.)

entry.title: Never, Never a frown
entry.summary:
Author: silly_sollie

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,562Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 37

Summary: He stared at her, uncomprehending. "Was? What do you mean, 'was'? Did they suffer the same fate? Did they pay for what they did?" He gestured frantically with his hands, a desperate plea for her to continue. Martha shook her head slowly, a grim, defeated expression settling on her face. "No, Clark, that's not what I mean. They… they still exist to this day. Thriving, even. More powerful than ever, by some accounts." She sighed, a deep, shuddering sound that spoke of decades of suppressed fear. She averted her gaze, turning her head to stare out the window, at the rolling hills of their quiet farm, as if looking for solace in the familiar landscape, before finally muttering out the name. "Gotham."

entry.title: Gods Don't Belong in Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,940Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 284

Summary: “Well?” he asked, his voice low.A pause.His eyes dragged over Clark, not with drunken lust but with something sharper.“You here to watch… or join? Might as well make it a threesome.”Clark choked on his own spit so hard he nearly doubled over, coughing. It's been 5 years since both Superman and Batman began their separate crusades. Both curious but cautious.Clark remains in Metropolis, respecting the Dark Knight's strict rule to keep metas out of Gotham. Meanwhile, Bruce is consumed with finding a balance between Batman and Bruce Wayne, determine to not repeat mistakes of the past. But it's hard to do that when he is too stubborn to accept help. Fortunately, for him Clark is just as stubborn.Their paths cross when Clark is sent to cover a gala in Gotham, stepping into the city he's barred from. What begins as a professional obligation turns into an unforgettable collision with Gotham's once reclusive billionaire. Or Clark and Bruce fall for each other slowly yet quickly.

entry.title: Like Sunshine After Rain
entry.summary:
Author: vela (volamena)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,382Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 254

Summary: Bruce’s fingers shift around Clark's bicep as if feeling for something. Clark watches as a myriad of emotions flutter through Bruce’s eyes, from suspicion to surprise to concern to suspicion again. Clark doesn’t know what to make of that. Did Bruce Wayne just…feel him up?“Er, Mr. Wayne?”Bruce retracts his hand like he's been burned. He shifts back into position, as if returning to his baseline state after mentally filing away some information. “I apologize, Mr. Kent. Thank you for your time today. Alfred will escort you out. Please have a safe trip back to Metropolis.”Now it’s Clark’s turn to stare at him. “Uh…right. Have a good night, Mr. Wayne.” Bruce just stares back.Yeah, Clark decides, Bruce Wayne is weird.
